Technique: FAYENCE; PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL; GLAZED
Name: Shabtis of Heka-em-saf
Description: These shabtis are of a high quality. They each have a back pillar and a small base. The hands are crossed in front of the chest, each holding a hoe and an adze, as well as the cord of a basket carried over the left shoulder. Each head is adorned with a long wig and a divine beard.
